intro: Onosma scorpioides, commonly known as the scorpioid onosma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific environmental requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
